bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Albert E. Truby, December 21, 1940

div1.p: Hench promises to return Truby's manuscript with comments next week.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Albert E. Truby, December 21, 1940
div1.opener:
leave on desk
December 21, 1940
General Albert E. Truby
145 Laurel Street
San Francisco, California
My dear General Truby:
div1.p:
You have been most kind and patient, indeed, and I am very ashamed
not to have returned your manuscript sooner.

I had hoped when I started for the Washington and Jefferson affair
to have finished that darned Rheumatism Review, but one of my colleagues fell
down on me and when I returned I found that I had to rewrite everything he
sent me, as it had been written so hastily. I have just this week finished
the Review.

With your kind indulgence I will hold your manuscript until next
week, and I absolutely promise to return it then with various comments and
questions. I thought you would prefer to have me keep it four or five extra
days and send you these rather than return it to you without the comments
I promised you.
May I wish you and yours a very Merry Christmas.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
